latestAction.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S888-889; text as passed Senate: CR S946)

item.title: A resolution authorizing the reporting of committee funding resolutions for the period March 1, 2013 through September 30, 2013.
A resolution authorizing the reporting of committee funding resolutions for the period March 1, 2013 through September 30, 2013.

bill.title: A resolution authorizing the reporting of committee funding resolutions for the period March 1, 2013 through September 30, 2013.

item.text:
Requires each committee, by February 26, 2013, to report one resolution authorizing the committee to make expenditures out of the Senate contingent fund to defray its expenses, including the compensation of members of its staff, from March 1, 2013, through September 30, 2013.

Authorizes the Senate Committee on Rules and Administration to report one authorization resolution containing more than one such committee authorization resolution.
item.name: Introduced in Senate

item.text:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Requires each committee, by February 26, 2013, to report one resolution authorizing the committee to make expenditures out of the Senate contingent fund to defray its expenses, including the compensation of members of its staff, from March 1, 2013, through September 30, 2013.

Authorizes the Senate Committee on Rules and Administration to report one authorization resolution containing more than one such committee authorization resolution.
item.name: Passed Senate without amendment

item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S888-889; text as passed Senate: CR S946)
Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S888-889; text as passed Senate: CR S946)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
